body: @PhilippSchmid I'm saying that sign into B2C is using B2C Authentication protocols. But to access personal OneNote via Microsoft Graph, you have to use Azure AD Authentication protocols. You cannot use a single login to achieve this requirement.

Thanks. I was to call the Microsoft Graph API for a user that previously authenticated via Azure B2C using a Microsoft account (one of the social IDPs we integrate with). Because they authenticated with a Microsoft account I know that they have access to OneNote (via Microsoft Graph API). I was hoping to avoid them having to log in a second time to access the Microsoft Graph API, but your answer doesn't address this scenario. I don't want to access the B2C tenant via Graph API but OneNote. Or are you saying that I can access the user's OneNote files via Graph API and B2C tenant?
